channel.title: Stuck Fire Doors
channel.description:
It seems that if an object gets stuck under a fire door, the door will not lower or raise or respond to the button that triggers those actions.
When I found this glitch, I had used a grenade to disable the turrets, which moved one of the turrets under the door and triggered the door to close. It got stuck at a height lower than crouch which made this area impossible to pass through. Also touching the door in this state was an instant death.
map : bm_c1a3a at: -35 x, -1258 y, -255 z setpos -35.646336 -1258.062988 -255.982117;setang 26.277779 11.186058 0.000000
![](upload://zHy2PF6eRb79ZvsbgOzsEauyX4B.jpeg)

item.title: Stuck Fire Doors
item.dc:creator: AutoDMC
item.description:
I’ve been able to replicate this. In my case, I’d already disabled the sentries and just wondered “what would happen if I jammed the door?”

In my case, because the sentry is upright, there’s no issue with crouching under the door. But it’s still instadeath and you can’t reverse it.

And that stench, Doctor, is a sentry gun burning under the pressure of an infinitely heavy lethal door.

Read full topic

item.title: Stuck Fire Doors

item.description:
It seems that if an object gets stuck under a fire door, the door will not lower or raise or respond to the button that triggers those actions.

When I found this glitch, I had used a grenade to disable the turrets, which moved one of the turrets under the door and triggered the door to close. It got stuck at a height lower than crouch which made this area impossible to pass through. Also touching the door in this state was an instant death.
